metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2047 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ssl_verify_server_cert function in sql-common/client.c in MariaDBbefore 5.5.47, 10.0.x before 10.0.23, and 10.1.x before 10.1.10; OracleMySQL 5.5.48 and earlier, 5.6.29 and earlier, and 5.7.11 and earlier; andPercona Server do not properly verify that the server hostname matches adomain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field ofthe X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoofSSL servers via a "/CN=" string in a field in a certificate, asdemonstrated by "/OU=/CN=bar.com/CN=foo.com."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2047` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.13-0ubuntu4').
